The 'Chicago Blackhawks' (spelled as 'Black Hawks' before 1986, and known
colloquially as the 'Hawks') are a professional ice hockey team based in
Chicago, Illinois. They are members of the Central Division of the Western
Conference of the National Hockey League (NHL). They are the defending Stanley
Cup Champions and have won five Stanley Cup championships since their founding
in 1926. The Blackhawks are one of the Original Six NHL teams (the only one in
the Western Conference or the Central Time Zone), along with the Detroit Red
Wings, Montreal Canadiens, Toronto Maple Leafs, Boston Bruins and New York
Rangers. Since the Blackhawks have played their home games at the United Center
after having spent 65 years playing at Chicago Stadium.
